elevator.rmi
Interface Motors

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Subinterfaces:
Elevators
All Known Implementing Classes:
MotorsImpl
public interface Motors
extends java.rmi.Remote

The remote interface for controlling all motors of elevators via RMI stub.

The interface is implemented by the proxy class elevator.rmi.impl.MotorsImpl. An object with the MotorsImpl class is created to control all motors at once or a group of motors or one motor of one elevator. The Motors interface can be used to start moving elevators up or down, to stop the elevators and to get current positions of the elevators. The getMotors() static method of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class is invoked to get a remote reference to the Motors object. For example: 

     MakeAll.init(localhost);
     ...
     Motors motors = MakeAll.getMotors();
     motors.up(); // move all elevators up
     motors.stop(1); // stop the first elevator
     if (motors.whereIs(4) < 2.888)
        motors.stop(4); // stop the 4th elevator on the 3rd floor
     int[] number = {1, 3, 5};
     int[] pos = motors.whereAre(number);
     motors.up({2, 4}); // move 2nd and 4th elevators up
     motors.move({1, 5}, {Motors.UP, Motors.DOWN});
It is worth noting that an object with the elevator.rmi.Motors interface allows controlling all motors, a group of motors or one motor, whereas an object with the elevator.rmi.Motor interface allows controlling only one motor.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
See Also:
MakeAll, Motor, Elevator, Elevators

Method Detail

down

public void down()
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Start moving all elevators down. If not stoped, the elevators stop automatically when they reach the bottom floor.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
down(int), down(int[]), move(int[])

down

public void down(int number)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 IllegalParamException
Start moving an elevator down. If not stoped, the elevator stops automatically when it reaches the bottom floor.
Parameters:
number - the integer number (1, 2, ...) of the elevator to start moving down
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
down(int[]), down(), move(int[],int[])

down

public void down(int[] number)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 IllegalParamException
Start moving a group of elevators down. If not stoped, the elevators stop automatically when they reach the bottom floor.
Parameters:
number - the array of integer numbers of elevators to start moving down
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if any elevator number from the number array is not a legal elevator number
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
down(int), down(), move(int[],int[])

move

public void move(int[] command)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 IllegalParamException
Start moving or stop all elevators.
Parameters:
command - the array of commands to start moving or to stop the elevators. The length of the commands array must be not less than the length of number. A command can be either of Motors.UP, Motors.DOWN, Motors.STOP which can be alternatively specified as 1, -1, 0, respectively.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if some element in the command array is not a legal command, or the length of the command array is less than the number of elevators.
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
move(int[], int[]), up(), down(), stop()

move

public void move(int[] number,
                 int[] command)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 IllegalParamException
Start moving or stop a group of elevators.
Parameters:
number - the array of integer numbers of elevators to be moved or stopped
command - the array of commands to start moving or to stop the elevators. The length of the command array must be not less than the length of number. A command can be either of Motors.UP, Motors.DOWN, Motors.STOP which can be alternatively specified as 1, -1, 0, respectively.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if some element in the command array is not a legal command, or some element in the number array is not a legal elevator number, or the length of the command array is less than the length of the number array.
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
move(int[]), up(int[]), down(int[]), stop(int[])

whereAre

public double[] whereAre()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Get current positions of all elevators.
Returns:
an array of double positions of the elevators in "floor units". For example, the value 2.5 "floor units" means that the elevator is located exactly in between the 2nd and 3rd floors.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
whereAre(int[]), whereIs(int)

whereAre

public double[] whereAre(int[] number)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Get current positions of a group of elevators.
Parameters:
number - an array of integer numbers (1, 2, ...) of elevators
Returns:
an array of double positions of the elevators in "floor units". For example, the value 2.5 "floor units" means that the elevator is located exactly in between the 2nd and 3rd floors.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if any of number is not a legal elevator number
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute *
See Also:
whereAre(), whereIs(int)

whereIs

public double whereIs(int number)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                      IllegalParamException
Get a current position of an elevator.
Parameters:
number - the integer number (1, 2, ...) of the elevator
Returns:
a double position of the elevator in "floor units". For example, the value 2.5 "floor units" means that the elevator is located exactly in between the 2nd and 3rd floors.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
